com.github.rholder.retry

Class WaitStrategies

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.rholder.retry.WaitStrategies

  • public final class WaitStrategies
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory class for instances of WaitStrategy.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static WaitStrategy exponentialWait()
      Returns a strategy which sleeps for an exponential amount of time after the first failed attempt, and in exponentially incrementing amounts after each failed attempt up to Long.MAX_VALUE.
      static WaitStrategy exponentialWait(long multiplier, long maximumTime, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit maximumTimeUnit)
      Returns a strategy which sleeps for an exponential amount of time after the first failed attempt, and in exponentially incrementing amounts after each failed attempt up to the maximumTime.
      static WaitStrategy exponentialWait(long maximumTime, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit maximumTimeUnit)
      Returns a strategy which sleeps for an exponential amount of time after the first failed attempt, and in exponentially incrementing amounts after each failed attempt up to the maximumTime.
      static WaitStrategy fixedWait(long sleepTime, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Returns a strategy that sleeps a fixed amount of time before retrying.
      static WaitStrategy incrementingWait(long initialSleepTime, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit initialSleepTimeUnit, long increment, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit incrementTimeUnit)
      Returns a strategy that sleeps a fixed amount of time after the first failed attempt, and in incrementing the amounts of time after each failed attempt.
      static WaitStrategy noWait()
      Returns a strategy that doesn't sleep at all before retrying.
      static WaitStrategy randomWait(long maximumTime, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Returns a strategy that sleeps a random amount of time before retrying.
      static WaitStrategy randomWait(long minimumTime, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit minimumTimeUnit, long maximumTime, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit maximumTimeUnit)
      Returns a strategy that sleeps a random amount of time before retrying.

    • Method Detail

      • noWait

        public static WaitStrategy noWait()
        Returns a strategy that doesn't sleep at all before retrying.

      • fixedWait

        public static WaitStrategy fixedWait(long sleepTime,
                     @Nonnull
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a strategy that sleeps a fixed amount of time before retrying.
        Parameters:
        sleepTime - the time to sleep
        timeUnit - the unit of the time to sleep
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the sleep time is < 0.

      • randomWait

        public static WaitStrategy randomWait(long maximumTime,
                      @Nonnull
                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Returns a strategy that sleeps a random amount of time before retrying.
        Parameters:
        maximumTime - the maximum time to sleep
        timeUnit - the unit of the maximum time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the maximum sleep time is <= 0.

      • randomWait

        public static WaitStrategy randomWait(long minimumTime,
                      @Nonnull
                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit minimumTimeUnit,
                      long maximumTime,
                      @Nonnull
                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit maximumTimeUnit)
        Returns a strategy that sleeps a random amount of time before retrying.
        Parameters:
        minimumTime - the minimum time to sleep
        minimumTimeUnit - the unit of the minimum time
        maximumTime - the maximum time to sleep
        maximumTimeUnit - the unit of the maximum time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the minimum sleep time is < 0, or if the maximum sleep time is less than (or equals to) the minimum.

      • incrementingWait

        public static WaitStrategy incrementingWait(long initialSleepTime,
                            @Nonnull
                            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit initialSleepTimeUnit,
                            long increment,
                            @Nonnull
                            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit incrementTimeUnit)
        Returns a strategy that sleeps a fixed amount of time after the first failed attempt, and in incrementing the amounts of time after each failed attempt.
        Parameters:
        initialSleepTime - the time to sleep before retrying the first time
        initialSleepTimeUnit - the unit of the initial sleep time
        increment - the increment added to the previous sleep time after each failed attempt
        incrementTimeUnit - the unit of the increment

      • exponentialWait

        public static WaitStrategy exponentialWait()
        Returns a strategy which sleeps for an exponential amount of time after the first failed attempt, and in exponentially incrementing amounts after each failed attempt up to Long.MAX_VALUE.

      • exponentialWait

        public static WaitStrategy exponentialWait(long maximumTime,
                           @Nonnull
                           java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit maximumTimeUnit)
        Returns a strategy which sleeps for an exponential amount of time after the first failed attempt, and in exponentially incrementing amounts after each failed attempt up to the maximumTime.
        Parameters:
        maximumTime - the maximum time to sleep
        maximumTimeUnit - the unit of the maximum time

      • exponentialWait

        public static WaitStrategy exponentialWait(long multiplier,
                           long maximumTime,
                           @Nonnull
                           java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit maximumTimeUnit)
        Returns a strategy which sleeps for an exponential amount of time after the first failed attempt, and in exponentially incrementing amounts after each failed attempt up to the maximumTime.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - multiply the wait time calculated by this
        maximumTime - the maximum time to sleep
        maximumTimeUnit - the unit of the maximum time
